alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the southern City of Portsmouth and the eastern City of Suffolk through 600 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Western Branch to near Gates. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Churchland, Downtown Suffolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Driver, Bowers Hill, Whaleyville, Western Branch, Suffolk Airport, Huntersville, Saunders, Magnolia, Somerton, Wilroy, Nurney, Kilby and Deanes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
